title: Bug 3666 - CodeCompletion Hungry code assist
description: Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add aparameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the codeassist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to controlthe amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option.
OB: The code is changed to:baz(x.foo().foo())I would rather it gave mebaz(x.foo()x.foo())public class X {void bar(X x) {baz(x.foo());}int foo() {return 5;}void baz(int i, int j) {}}KUM (5/21/01 9:02:11 AM)The text to replace is computed by the code assist infrastructure.Moved to ITPJCORE.PM (9/4/2001 2:58:56 PM)Option was added.PM (9/25/2001 2:20:50 PM)Removing option.
EB: The code assist should provide the correct suggestion for the baz call in bar. Instead of giving me 'baz(x.foo())', it should give me 'baz(x.foo(), x.foo())'.
SR:
1. Change the baz call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press Ctrl + Space to bring up code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()'.
6. Observe the suggestion provided by code assist.
